c74object.name: zsa.skewness~
c74object.digest: zsa.skewness~ returns a measure of the asymmetry of a spectrum around its barycenter.
c74object.description: zsa.skewness~ is considered as the third spectral moment. The spectral skewness value "sk" describes the degree of asymetry of a spectral distribution. sk = 0 indicates a symmetric distribution, sk < 0 indicates more energy on the right, sk > 0 indicates more energy on the left. The object works in the spectral domain, so you need to use it whithin pfft~.

method.name: (mouse)
method.description: Double-clicking on the object causes the Zsa Descriptors splash screen to appear. You'll find the version number and date there.

method.name: signal
method.description: If both signal inlets are connected, left signal inlet expects real values and right inlet expects imaginary values. If the left inlet is the only signal connected input, the signal is interpreted as the energy (you need to calculate it using cartopol~ or better zsa.energy~).

attribute.name: threshold
attribute.description: threshold sets noise threshold in linear scale (the default value is 0.0). It helps zsa.skewness~ to avoid calculating values on unwanted smaller low amplitude data.
